abstract: Sallie L. Krawcheck, who led Citigroup’s global wealth management division, was pushed out after months of friction with the chief executive.
snippet: Sallie L. Krawcheck, who led Citigroup’s global wealth management division, was pushed out after months of friction with the chief executive.
lead_paragraph: Sallie L. Krawcheck, the most prominent woman on Wall Street, was pushed out at Citigroup on Monday after months of friction with its chief executive, Vikram S. Pandit.

headline.main: Most Prominent Woman on Wall Street Is Out at Citi
headline.print_headline: A High-Ranking Woman Is Out at Citi

byline.original: By Eric Dash and Geraldine Fabrikant

abstract: Here is the text of the testimony prepared for delivery before the Senate Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs on Tuesday by Ben S. Bernanke, the chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, as released by Mr. Paulson’s office (including one footnote)..
